briefdescription.para: Function for erasing a page in flash.

detaileddescription.para: This function blocks until the erase operation finishes.

simplesect.para: Depending on the source of the code being executed, the CPU may be halted during the operation. Refer to the Product Specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: Address of the first word in the page to erase.
Page erase complete.
Address is not aligned to the size of the page.

briefdescription.para: Function for erasing the user information configuration register (UICR).

simplesect.para: Depending on the source of the code being executed, the CPU may be halted during the operation. Refer to the Product Specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: UICR has been successfully erased.
UICR erase is not supported.

briefdescription.para: Function for erasing the whole flash memory.

simplesect.para: All user code and UICR will be erased.

briefdescription.para: Function for initiating a complete page erase split into parts (also known as partial erase).

detaileddescription.para: This function initiates a partial erase with the specified duration. To execute each part of the partial erase, use nrfx_nvmc_page_partial_erase_continue.

parameterdescription.para: Address of the first word in the page to erase.
Time in milliseconds that each partial erase will take.
Partial erase started.
Address is not aligned to the size of the page.

briefdescription.para: Function for performing a part of the complete page erase (also known as partial erase).

detaileddescription.para: This function must be called several times to erase the whole page, once for each erase part.

simplesect.para: The actual time needed to perform each part of the page erase is longer than the partial erase duration specified in the call to nrfx_nvmc_page_partial_erase_init, since the NVMC peripheral needs certain additional amount of time to handle the process. For details regarding this additional time, see the "Electrical specification" section for the NVMC peripheral in the Product Specification.

Using a page that was not completely erased leads to undefined behavior. Depending on the source of the code being executed, the CPU may be halted during the operation. Refer to the Product Specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: Partial erase finished.
Partial erase not finished. Call the function again to process the next part.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking whether a byte is writable at the specified address.

detaileddescription.para: The NVMC is only able to write '0' to bits in the flash that are erased (set to '1'). It cannot rewrite a bit back to '1'. This function checks if the value currently residing at the specified address can be transformed to the desired value without any '0' to '1' transitions.

parameterdescription.para: Address to be checked.
Value to be checked.
Byte can be written at the specified address.
Byte cannot be written at the specified address. Erase the page or change the address.

briefdescription.para: Function for writing a single byte to flash.

detaileddescription.para: To determine if the flash write has been completed, use nrfx_nvmc_write_done_check().

simplesect.para: Depending on the source of the code being executed, the CPU may be halted during the operation. Refer to the Product Specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: Address to write to.
Value to write.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking whether a halfword is writable at the specified address.

detaileddescription.para: The NVMC is only able to write '0' to bits in the Flash that are erased (set to '1'). It cannot rewrite a bit back to '1'. This function checks if the value currently residing at the specified address can be transformed to the desired value without any '0' to '1' transitions.

parameterdescription.para: Address to be checked. Must be halfword-aligned.
Value to be checked.
Halfword can be written at the specified address.
Halfword cannot be written at the specified address. Erase page or change address.

briefdescription.para: Function for writing a 16-bit halfword to flash.

detaileddescription.para: To determine if the flash write has been completed, use nrfx_nvmc_write_done_check().

simplesect.para: Depending on the source of the code being executed, the CPU may be halted during the operation. Refer to the Product Specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: Address to write to. Must be halfword-aligned.
Value to write.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking whether a word is writable at the specified address.

detaileddescription.para: The NVMC is only able to write '0' to bits in the Flash that are erased (set to '1'). It cannot rewrite a bit back to '1'. This function checks if the value currently residing at the specified address can be transformed to the desired value without any '0' to '1' transitions.

parameterdescription.para: Address to be checked. Must be word-aligned.
Value to be checked.
Word can be written at the specified address.
Word cannot be written at the specified address. Erase page or change address.

briefdescription.para: Function for writing a 32-bit word to flash.

detaileddescription.para: To determine if the flash write has been completed, use nrfx_nvmc_write_done_check().

simplesect.para: Depending on the source of the code being executed, the CPU may be halted during the operation. Refer to the Product Specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: Address to write to. Must be word-aligned.
Value to write.

briefdescription.para: Function for writing consecutive bytes to flash.

detaileddescription.para: To determine if the last flash write has been completed, use nrfx_nvmc_write_done_check().

simplesect.para: Depending on the source of the code being executed, the CPU may be halted during the operation. Refer to the Product Specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: Address to write to.
Pointer to the data to copy from.
Number of bytes to write.

briefdescription.para: Function for writing consecutive words to flash.

detaileddescription.para: To determine if the last flash write has been completed, use nrfx_nvmc_write_done_check().

simplesect.para: Depending on the source of the code being executed, the CPU may be halted during the operation. Refer to the Product Specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: Address to write to. Must be word-aligned.
Pointer to data to copy from. Must be word-aligned.
Number of words to write.

briefdescription.para: Function for reading a 16-bit aligned halfword from the OTP (UICR)

detaileddescription.para: OTP is a region of the UICR present in some chips. This function must be used to read halfword data from this region since unaligned accesses are not available on the OTP flash area.

parameterdescription.para: Address to read from. Must be halfword-aligned.
contents at address.

briefdescription.para: Function for reading a 32-bit aligned word from the UICR.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be used to read from the UICR since reading the flash main memory area straight after reading the UICR results in undefined behaviour for nRF9160.

simplesect.para: See anomaly 7 in the errata document.

parameterdescription.para: Address to read from. Must be word-aligned.
contents at address.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the total flash size in bytes.
Function for getting the flash page size in bytes.
Function for getting the flash page count.
Function for checking if the last flash write has been completed.

parameterdescription.para: Last write completed successfully.
Last write is still in progress.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling the Instruction Cache (ICache).

detaileddescription.para: Enabling ICache reduces the amount of accesses to flash memory, which can boost performance and lower power consumption.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling ICache.
